title: England's Rugby World Cup decider against France 'is moved 500 MILES to Oita due to typhoon'
text:
England's Rugby World Cup pool decider against France has been thrown into chaos with Super Typhoon Hagibis forcing organisers to draw up plans that could see the game moved 500 miles away or cancelled.

Torrential rain and violent winds are forecast for Saturday in Tokyo and Yokohama, where the clash is due to take place, and moving the game to Oita on the Japanese island of Kyushu is now being considered by RWC chiefs.

Typhoon Hagibis - the 19th typhoon of this storm season - had been heading towards the south west of the country but changed course and is now due to tear through the Tokyo and Yokohama area this weekend.

England's World Cup decider against France could be moved 500 miles away due to typhoon

Saturday's game was scheduled to be played in Yokohama, where the typhoon is heading for

Organisers are planning to stage the game in Oita, 500 miles away from Yokohama

Meteorologist Robert Speta, an expert on typhoons who now works for the US Navy in Florida, said the storm had gone through an 'explosive intensification.'

The Super Typhoon is being put on par with a category five hurricane with violent winds of up to 160mph expected.

70,000 fans face missing the clash according to The Telegraph, with RWC chiefs considering staging the game behind closed doors in order to ensure the safety of spectators who might try to travel to the game.

England and France were informed about the contingency plans on Wednesday and are now taking necessary steps to arrange transport.

Typhoon Hagibis is being put on par with a category 5 hurricane with 160mph winds expected

England trained in Tokyo on Wednesday and have been informed of the proposed plans

A press briefing will be called for midday Thursday (4am UK) to spell out the plan to cope with the 'anticipated impact of England vs France and other games this weekend'.

Original tournament rules state that any pool game expected to be affected by adverse weather conditions would be cancelled as opposed to postponed with two points awarded to each side.

Organisers are however instead contemplating this unprecedented move to relocate the game as the final standings in the pool are not yet assured.

The Japan vs Scotland game on Sunday is also likely to be affected and could also be relocated.
description: In an unprecedented move, Rugby World Cup chiefs have taken the decision to move England's final Pool C game from Yokohama as Super Typhoon Hagibis heads for landfall in Tokyo.
